intro: Anthyllis pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered anthyllis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to poor soils. Anthyllis pallidiflora is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environments.
